SEARCH
Package com.app.persistence.repository

Interface OrderRepository

All Superinterfaces:
CrudRepository<OrderEntity>, org.springframework.data.repository.CrudRepository<OrderEntity,Long>, org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository<OrderEntity,Long>, org.springframework.data.repository.ListCrudRepository<OrderEntity,Long>, org.springframework.data.repository.ListPagingAndSortingRepository<OrderEntity,Long>, org.springframework.data.repository.PagingAndSortingRepository<OrderEntity,Long>, org.springframework.data.repository.query.QueryByExampleExecutor<OrderEntity>, org.springframework.data.repository.Repository<OrderEntity,Long>
public interface OrderRepository extends CrudRepository<OrderEntity>
Repository interface for managing OrderEntity entities in the persistence layer.

This interface extends the CrudRepository and provides additional custom query methods for retrieving orders and related data, such as clients with the highest total payment, most common product categories, and clients with debit balances.

  • Method Details

    • getClientWithBiggerPayment

      @Query("select o.clientEntity\n from OrderEntity o\n group by o.clientEntity\n having sum(o.productEntity.price) =\n (select max(totalPrice)\n from( select sum(o.productEntity.price) as totalPrice from OrderEntity o group by o.clientEntity))") List<ClientEntity> getClientWithBiggerPayment()
      Retrieves a list of clients who have made the highest total payment.

      The query calculates the total price of products purchased by each client and returns the clients with the highest total payment.

      Returns:
      a list of ClientEntity objects representing the clients with the highest total payment

    • getClientWithBiggerPaymentInCategory

      @Query("select o.clientEntity\n from OrderEntity o\n where o.productEntity.category = :category\n group by o.clientEntity\n having sum(o.productEntity.price) =\n (select max(totalPrice)\n from( \n select sum(o2.productEntity.price) as totalPrice\n from OrderEntity o2\n where o2.productEntity.category = :category\n group by o2.clientEntity)\n )") List<ClientEntity> getClientWithBiggerPaymentInCategory(String category)
      Retrieves a list of clients who have made the highest total payment in a specific product category.

      The query calculates the total price of products purchased by each client within a specific category and returns the clients with the highest total payment within that category.

      Parameters:
      category - the product category to filter by
      Returns:
      a list of ClientEntity objects representing the clients with the highest total payment in the specified category

    • getAgeAndMostCategory

      @Query(value="select c.age as age, p.category as category\nfrom orders o\njoin clients c on o.client_id = c.id\njoin products p on o.product_id = p.id\ngroup by c.age, p.category\nhaving count(p.category) = (\n select max(amount)\n from (select count(p2.category) as amount\n from orders o2\n join clients c2 on o2.client_id = c2.id\n join products p2 on o2.product_id = p2.id\n where c2.age = c.age\n group by p2.category)\n as total);\n", nativeQuery=true) List<AgeMostOftenCategoryProjection> getAgeAndMostCategory()
      Retrieves the most common product category for each age group.

      The query groups the orders by client age and product category, and selects the category that occurs the most frequently for each age group.

      Returns:
      a list of AgeMostOftenCategoryProjection containing the most common product category for each age group

    • getCategoryAndMostClient

      @Query(value="select p.category as category,\nc.id as id,\nc.name as name,\nc.surname as surname,\nc.age as age,\nc.cash as cash\nfrom orders o\njoin clients c on c.id = o.client_id\njoin products p on p.id = o.product_id\ngroup by p.category, c.id\nhaving count(p.category) = (select max(totalCount)\nfrom (select count(p2.category) as totalCount\n from orders o2\n join clients c2 on c2.id = o2.client_id\n join products p2 on p2.id = o2.product_id\n where p.category = p2.category\n group by c2.id, p2.category) as maxCounts);", nativeQuery=true) List<CategoryAndMostClientProjection> getCategoryAndMostClient()
      Retrieves the clients who have purchased the most items within the same product category.

      The query groups the orders by product category and client, and selects the clients who purchased the most items in a given category.

      Returns:
      a list of CategoryAndMostClientProjection representing the clients who purchased the most items within a product category

    • getClientAndDebit

      @Query(value="select new com.app.persistence.entity.view.ClientAndDebitDto(\no.clientEntity.id,\no.clientEntity.name,\no.clientEntity.surname,\no.clientEntity.age,\no.clientEntity.cash,\no.clientEntity.cash - sum(o.productEntity.price)\n) from OrderEntity o\ngroup by o.clientEntity.id, o.clientEntity.name, o.clientEntity.surname, o.clientEntity.age, o.clientEntity.cash\nhaving o.clientEntity.cash - sum(o.productEntity.price) < 0\n", nativeQuery=false) List<ClientAndDebitDto> getClientAndDebit()
      Retrieves a list of clients who have a debit balance (i.e., clients whose total spending exceeds their available cash).

      The query calculates the total amount spent by each client and compares it with their available cash, returning clients with negative balances.

      Returns:
      a list of ClientAndDebitDto objects representing clients with a debit balance

    • getAgeAndMostProduct

      @Query(value="select c.age as age,\n p.id as id,\n p.name as name,\n p.category as category,\n p.price as price from orders o\n join clients c on c.id = o.client_id\n join products p on p.id = o.product_id\ngroup by c.age, p.id\nhaving count(p.id) = (select max(count) from (\n select count(p2.id) as count\n from orders o2\n join clients c2 on c2.id = o2.client_id\n join products p2 on p2.id = o2.product_id\n where c.age = c2.age\n group by c2.age, p2.id) as sec)", nativeQuery=true) List<AgeAndMostProductProjection> getAgeAndMostProduct()
      Retrieves the most frequently purchased products for each client age group.

      The query groups the orders by client age and product ID, selecting the product that was purchased the most frequently by clients of each age.

      Returns:
      a list of AgeAndMostProductProjection containing the most frequently purchased products for each age group
